intro: Bulbocodium rollii, commonly known as the Cape Peninsula bulbous plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous underground storage organs. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
